conclusion: To predict which container (D, E, or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, the solution will analyze the images step by step.
Liquid from A flows downward and hits the purple baffle.
The purple baffle directs the liquid from A to the left, where it flows onto the green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid from A further left, where it flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows downward and hits the purple baffle.
The purple baffle directs the liquid from B to the right, where it flows onto the green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid from B downward, where it flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows downward and hits the brown baffle.
The brown baffle directs the liquid from C to the right, where it flows into container F.
The first image shows the initial setup with the baffles and containers labeled.
The second image shows the orange liquid from A flowing left via the purple and green baffles toward container D.
The second image shows the blue liquid from B flowing downward via the purple and green baffles toward container E.
The second image shows the white liquid from C flowing downward via the brown baffle toward container F.
The third image confirms the final flow paths: orange liquid from A ends in container D, blue liquid from B ends in container E, and white liquid from C ends in container F.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
